sense.name: a representation of some geographical region
sense.examples: John pulled out the road map to find a good route to the ski resort. We looked at some 17th-century maps of the New World in the museum. The research sub is creating a map of a portion of the sea floor. Expansion of the surface sector is reshaping the map of employment. (figurative extension)

sense.name: a mathematical function defined between two sets
sense.examples: This function is a one-to-one map between members of the domain and members of the range.

sense.name: a visualization of quantitative data
sense.examples: The textbook has a diagram showing an electron density map. These diagrams are maps of the 14th and 15th human chromosomes. The data visualization program creates maps of daily market volatility and risk exposures.

sense.name: remote or unknown place
sense.examples: It was a tiny town, off the map in west Texas. We are basically off the map with this economic situation.

sense.name: bring something to prominence
sense.examples: That exhibition put Cubism on the map in the world of art. Until last month, their candidate was not really on the map in the gubernatorial race.

sense.name: obliterate something totally
sense.examples: The dictator threatened to wipe that nation off the map. Mary made sure Bob's proposal was wiped off the map before the meeting with the Board of Directors.
